_comment: Created by hdorning on 23/08/2017 15:41:19 using v2.7
title: Which organisations are responsible for the number of delayed days?
analysis_commentary:
Between April 2011 and April 2017, the total number of delayed days accrued in a month when the delay is attributable to NHS organisations has increased by approximately 47%. The increase was 95% for social care organisations and 69% when both organisations are responsible. The total number of delayed days was fairly static between August 2010 and February 2015. However, after February 2015 the number of delayed days began to increase at a far greater rate than it had done previously.

Updated July 2017.
